EXTRACTED VALUE: The definitive football game to buy this season.
Pushing the humble PSone to its absolute limits, Square have done the impossible and actually improved on FFVIII's visuals.
Aside from the “who the hell thought this was a good idea” boss battles, Guitar Hero III is a must-buy for vets and newbies alike.
As I said before, THPS had a good run, but its time to grow up. SKATE is the game that will force us to do just that.
EA didn't just make their game look, sound, and play superbly, but they even brought their "A" game when it comes to features as well.
Joy has rarely come so reasonably priced and, whatever the price, videogames, rarely come so joyful. Indispensable, then.
The best racing game you'll find on the PS one, hands down. [Mar 2002, p.34]
Race Driver GRID is an immersing, addictive, exhilarating, beautiful and fun racing experience you can’t afford to miss, the best so far.
One of the most nicely immersive titles I’ve seen.
The new commentating team, Backtrack replays, soundtrack, and improved graphics really packs that extra punch of realism making this game a must buy.
GRAW 2 is stunning to look at, great to listen to and most of all fun to play – especially if you like cooperative multiplayer.
The Darkness isn’t all that long and clocks in at about 10 hours, but it feels fresh the entire way through and doesn’t overstay its welcome.
The result is sweaty-palmed fun, teaming the adult joys of a well-paced thriller with the childish delight of playing hide-and-seek in the dark.
To put it simply, Fight Night Round 3 kicks our ass. [Apr 2006, p.74]
